str2: One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: To teach, direct, admonish. A prolonged form of a primary verb dao; to teach.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Apparently a primary word; a people.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Neuter of hieros; a sacred place, i.e. The entire precincts of the Temple.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle - Genitive Masculine Singular
str2: From eu and aggelos; to announce good news especially the gospel.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
High priest, chief priest. From arche and hiereus; the high-priest; by extension a chief priest.
From gramma. A writer, i.e. scribe or secretary.
With. A primary preposition denoting union; with or together.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Comparative of presbus; older; as noun, a senior; specially, an Israelite Sanhedrist or Christian 'presbyter'.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To stand by, be urgent, befall one (as of evil), be at hand, impend. From epi and histemi; to stand upon, i.e. Be present.
